criteria.name: Application of Team Design Variables
criteria.description: Assess how effectively the student applies key team design variables (roles, norms, goals, charters) and connects them to the scenario.

scoringLevels.full: Effectively applies multiple team design variables with clear connections to the scenario.
scoringLevels.partial: Applies some team design variables but connections to the scenario are limited.
scoringLevels.minimal: Minimal or incorrect application of team design variables.

criteria.name: Identification and Prevention of Social Loafing
criteria.description: Evaluate the identification of social loafing, its causes, and actionable solutions based on course material.

scoringLevels.full: Clearly identifies social loafing, explains relevant causes, and proposes effective solutions based on course concepts.
scoringLevels.partial: Partially identifies social loafing with some relevant solutions but lacks depth or connection to course material.
scoringLevels.minimal: Inadequate identification of social loafing or solutions that aren't based on course material.

criteria.name: Organization and Clarity of Argument
criteria.description: Evaluate the logical flow, clarity, and structure of the response, ensuring arguments are well-supported and tied to course material.

scoringLevels.full: Well-organized response with clear logical flow and arguments well-supported by course material.
scoringLevels.partial: Somewhat organized with basic logical flow but some gaps in clarity or support from course material.
scoringLevels.minimal: Poorly organized response lacking logical flow or connections to course material.
